thread.title: Places to visit at Ranga Reddy
thread.title_full: Places to visit at Ranga Reddy | Free Press Journal

author: FPJ Bureau
title: Places to visit at Ranga Reddy
text:
> The state of Telanga has come up to create its identity with many delightful places to offer. Ranga Reddy District, formerly known as K. V. Ranga Reddy District is one such example. It has stood out to be in offering an amazing travel experience for those who have hauled here. The fresh breeze of the hills, with temples that go back up to 12 th century and man made wonders which win hearts of visitors here; Ranga Reddy is a must visit with all these goodies.
Ranga Reddy does not have its own airport or railway station; hence the best way to reach here is via Hyderabad, the state capital which is 73 km from here.
Ananthagiri Hills It is located around 10 km from Vikarabad. The hills here are the main source of water for Osman Sagar Lake. It is one of the dense forests in Telangana which has the Sri Anantha Padmanabha Swamy temple located here. A soothing place with vibrant greens all around is a glorious opportunity for nature lovers.
Ananthagiri Hills
Picture credits: Praveen120 / Wikipedia
Sri Anantha Padmanabha Swamy Temple A temple located amidst the gorgeous hilly region of Ananthagiri hills in Vikarabad is perfect for a spiritual visit. It is dedicated to Lord Vishnu and was constructed by Rishi Markandeya. It is a gigantic structure, completely white and is highly visited by devotees here.
Sri Anantha Padmanabha Swamy Temple
Picture credits: Nagaraju raveender / Wikipedia
Must read: Assimilate the tranquility of Adilabad Osman Sagar Lake It is also known as Gandipet and is an excellent picnic spot on the outskirts of the city. It is also a source for supplying drinking water to the city. It is a man made reservoir created by constructing a dam across Isa, a tributary of Musi River. It was constructed by Mir Osman Ali Khan in 1920 and hence the name. It is a beautiful public recreation spot with mesmerizing landscapes. The lake also offers activities like boating to add more of an exciting time here.
Osman Sagar Lake
Picture credits: Vangala / Flicker
Chilkur Balaji Temple In our earlier story of the 10 most weird temples of India we had mentioned this one which is also known as Visa temple. The deity here is said to fulfil your wish of going abroad. Thousands of devotees visit every year with the desire of getting their visas approved.
Chilkur Balaji Temple
Picture credits: www.holidayiq.com
Ramoji Film City It is a mind boggling theme park which spreads over 2000 acres is created for shooting films. Ramoji Film City is a refreshing getaway with your family and friends. It includes a number of rides and attractions like Sun Fountain, Japanese Garden, Angel’s Fountain, Jail, Princess Street, Eureka, Airport, Railway Station, Action, Temple, Gardens, Ramoji Tower, and Film World.
Ramoji Film City
Picture credits: www.hoparoundindia.com
Karmanghat Hanuman Temple It is a bright orange colour structure located at Karmanghat. It is dedicated to Lord Hanuman and is one of the oldest temples in Hyderabad. It was constructed in the 12 th century by the Kakatiya dynasty. Legend says that, when Aurangzeb ordered his army to destroy this temple they couldn’t even enter. After learning this, Aurangzeb, himself went there to wipe out the temple with a with a crow bar in his hand. However, he failed too and instead heard a voice saying Mandir todna hai raja, to kar maan ghat” which means, oh king, if you want to destroy this temple, then make your heart strong. This is how it derived its name and has gained popularity since then.
Karmanghat Hanuman Temple
Picture credits: Sriharsha Rao / Wikipedia
Keesaragutta Temple It is another Hindu shrine dedicated to Lord Shiva. It is situated on a hill and is packed full of devotees on the occasion of Shivaratri. Beside the temple there is a huge statue of Lord Hanuman joining hands.
Keesaragutta Temple
Picture credits: www.yatrastotemples.com
Sanghi Temple It is one of the most famous temples here and is adorned for being a marble beauty. It is surrounded by lush vegetation which adds a stunning appeal to its beauty. It has been a prominent place for filming Telegu movies as well. It has a Chola-Chalukya style of architecture which gives the temple a touch of historical importance too.
Sanghi Temple
Picture credits: www.yatrastotemples.com
If you’re an adventure enthusiast, Ranga Reddy is home to the Mrugavani National Park and Shamirpet Deer Park which are famous spots for those who wish to enjoy a thrilling wildlife experience. You can also indulge in rock climbing and rappelling at the Vikarabad Adventure which offers these activities for tourists.
Mrugavani National Park
Picture credits: natureconservation.in
A place like Ranga Reddy offers diversity for travellers from historical monuments to amazing wildlife amidst lush green forests which are hard to maintain with the growth of urban development. Free Press Journal requests its readers to take a step in maintaining such places and preserving their pure essence.
